Class FESI.Data.ESPrimitive 

FESI.Data.ESValue
   |
   +----FESI.Data.ESPrimitive
public abstract class ESPrimitive
extends ESValue
This is the superclass of all primitive values (non object) of FESI. The conversion to a primitive value from a primitive value is always the same value, independently of the hint (9.1).

Use the isPrimitive function, so that further primitive could be added without subclassing this class.

ESPrimitive()
Create a new primitive value.

getDescription(String)
Returns a full description of the value, with the specified name.
isComposite()
Return false to indicate that this value is not composite.
isPrimitive()
Indicate that this value is a primitive value, useful for various tests in conversions.
toESPrimitive()
Convert to a primitive - a NOOP for a primitive.
toESPrimitive(int)
Convert to a primitive - a NOOP for a primitive.

ESPrimitive 
 public ESPrimitive()
Create a new primitive value. Does not add any specific information.

isPrimitive 
 public final boolean isPrimitive()
Indicate that this value is a primitive value, useful for various tests in conversions. This avoid testing the type, in case additional primitives must be created.

Returns:
true
Overrides:
isPrimitive in class ESValue
isComposite 
 public boolean isComposite()
Return false to indicate that this value is not composite.

Returns:
false
Overrides:

 public final ESValue toESPrimitive() throws EcmaScriptException
Convert to a primitive - a NOOP for a primitive.

Returns:
this
Throws: EcmaScriptException
not thrown
